Finally we shared the red neck wedding cake which was outstanding.  The spicy nuts made the dish very interesting instead of just a good chocolate care with cheerwine(!) icing.  They are not afraid to go bold in this restaurant and it succeeds.  I hope they get more business so that they stay around!

Order Three Things:  *Braised Short Rib-Yummy & Soooo Tender!  *Ham Mac & Cheese-Sauce flavorful but Noodles were uncooked.  *Rabbit Pot Pie-Cooked just right but on the sour side. Huge chunks of Rabbit! :)    *$5 Wine Tasting on Wednesday Nights!   *Service was pretty good.

Good wine selection but the food is way overpriced. Or, I should say the portions are extremely small. Good quality but there are lots of places in Uptown Charlotte with food that's equally good but either with larger portions or better prices. Atmosphere is quiet and sometimes they have live music. The servers are friendly and attentive.   While I like the decor, service and wine selection, I have to say I would recommend other places over this one if you want to eat while sipping your wine.

Really a 3.5. Stopped by here around happy hour. There are a ton of options for wine and a limited food menu. What I most enjoyed was the ambiance of the bar, as the entire place had an aroma of fresh cut wood and was made of wood. Service was prompt and food was prepared quickly and was very hot. The spinach dip was very cheesy. Unfortunately, the crab dip lacked chunks of crab, which would have made it better. While everything was pretty good, nothing stood out as special. I'd recommend it for a go to, low key post work meet up.

I went here with a group of 7 on a Saturday night.  We we're greeted as we walked in and told to sit where ever we'd like. The wooden architecture is really beautiful and creates a cool vibe in the restaurant.  I loved this place because you don't have to yell over the music to hear each other : )  It also happened to be Acoustic night, there was a gentleman playing a guitar and singing some good popular tunes. Both of the appetizer dips (hummus, Cheese) were really tasty and their pizzas tasted fresh and yummy!   My friends and I are by no means savants when it comes to wine or beer but they seemed to carry a good selection of both.  I would recommend checking out their menus on their website to know if they carry what you like. I was slightly disappointed that they were out of two of the four desserts they carried. I ended up getting the honey orange mousse, which tasted a little bland once the drizzle of honey was gone... The service was very quick and all of the employees were super polite. I would definitely Dine and Wine here again!

Very cool spot in the middle of Uptown Charlotte. Stopped here while on a trip to Charlotte after hearing it was a great wine bar. It's a very chill atmosphere where you can chose from a nice wine selection and relax. The bar itself is a long curvy piece of wood which adds a nice flavor to the bar.   The bartender was very knowledgable on all their wines and gave pretty thorough explanations as to which wines from which countries he recommended. My wine was delicious and I definitely would have had a a few more if I didn't have to head out. They also had a pretty awesome looking desert menu that i unfortunately was too full to sample, but it's the perfect compliment to a nice glass of wine. The location is perfect as its right the middle of uptown Charlotte with easy access to everything else.   Very nice place worth checking out.

We kind of ended up here on a whim while driving through downtown Charlotte. I had a hankering for some wine and so did my husband and in-laws (there were 7 of us).   Anyway upon our arrival, we were promptly seated at one of their comfy couches and proceeded to appreciate how awesome the décor was. I felt like I was visiting a wino Keebler elf inside his tree!! The place was cozy and had amazing wooden accents, even the bathroom was something to check out.   Now, for service, our waiter/bartender was very helpful. he was able to suggest a sweet drink for someone in our party as well as helpful wine suggestions. My mother in law and I opted for a wine flight each. Man, let me tell ya, the pours were generous and the wines incredible! I had the Sophisticated Palate and enjoyed every bit of it. The prices for the flight were not bad at all either. My family and I totally enjoyed the ambiance and great customer service. If I come back to Charlotte, you bet I would be coming back!
Delicious sweet potato gnocchi and great service.  I spent $15 for lunch with the meal, drink & tip which was a great deal.

A rather unique little spot to pull into.  First of all, the ambiance is wonderful.  The bar is like a large tree cut in half and laid horizontally right when you walk in.  I haven't gotten a chance to try any of the food yet but the wine and bottled beer menu is rather extensive.  The wife and I love stopping in here randomly and chatting over a glass of wine.  You should really give it a try.  I will update the review once I try the food.  Enjoy!  -Ian M.
sit at the bar. the bar staff is great and recommends the best plates and wine/beer. the menu changes frequently but the sliders, tuna tacos, and quail are fantastic.

First time visiting for an early birthday gift and such a cool and unique spot. Located in the outer skirts of Uptown this is a hidden gem although located on a main street .   Ordered a few appetizers since everything sounds so yummy when you're hungry. The service was great although it was pretty dead coming in early part of the afternoon. Ordered the Old Fashioned which is a favorite of mine which was well made. Crab Cakes, Shrimp and I believe the meatballs is what we ordered which again very well prepared. Also ordered an assortment of cheese & meats which went very well with the appetizers.  I would highly recommend as a first time visitor and perfect for date nights or first dates. Wine assortments is very extensive also. The wood tables are also awesome.

NEW BRUNCH IS WORTH IT!  On Feb 23rd my friends and I were staying uptown for the weekend and had troubles finding a brunch on a Saturday without a cab ride. We found out that Feb 23rd was Wooden Vine's inaugural brunch! We were literally the first people in for an early seating. The server admitted they were still working out kinks, but rest assured the chefs were to not dissapoint. The food was divine and met the needs of our group (some hungover, some vegitarian, and all looking for a gourmet meal with good service). The meals came out somewhat staggered, but something we were able to look past since this was a 7 person party for the very first brunch served. Our waiter was upfront and we laughed it off. Will definately be back and even if you live in surrounding neighborhoods- it's worth your trip uptown!

We visited the Wooden vine on the Tour De Food and then came back later that night. The atmosphere was fantastic and a young man (23yrs) who was the bartender slash wine expert was amazing, thoughtful, and helpful. We tried some amazing wines and shared the venison sweet breads. The only thing that I would say was I wish there had been more. We also tried a pork belly potsticker type of item that was amazing and very filling. It was a Saturday night and we were seated fast and had excellent service. I would not bring my country family here (they do not appreciate nice wine or fancy food) but I would bring anyone I wanted to impress.

Beautiful place to grab a glass of wine. Stopped in here after dinner- but looks like a great place to eat too. They have mystery wines and that's a lot of fun. I got a delicious sav blanc that I'll have to pick up from the store. The girl working here looked exactly like the actress Kristen Bell! Wow! :) Really charming place with beautiful people & decor.

Was getting worried about this place as it had been on a down trajectory since Andrew left but the new manager and recent bar hires have all been home runs.   Also really impressed with the new chef who started a couple weeks ago. He is local and makes fantastic roasted vegetable flatbread and does amazing things with mushrooms and peppers. Very talented young chef.   And they finally added charcuterie and wine flights to compliment their great wines. Welcome back!

Love this place!! I have been exposed to some of my favorite wines at this restaurant. The staff especially is excellent!! Bethany figured out what types of wine I like and let me try some amazing new ones. They always remember us and even the wine glasses we prefer. There are a lot of wine restaurants in Charlotte but this one stands out. Outstanding service and selection. We bring all of our out of town guest there and we are never disappointed. Highly recommended!!

Post dinner uptown on a Friday night, we were in the mood for another drink, sans the typical uptown weekend madness (especially on a game night), enter Wooden Vine.  As other have mentioned, I did enjoy the decor, especially as we bellied up to the beautifully gnarled wood bar and took in the drink menu. A decent amount of by the glass options, and a more extensive than expected food menu, though I didn't really look to hard at it, and a (for the most part) full bar. They seemed to have some decent nightly drink specials during the week.   The music switched between soft alternative(?) recordings and a live act, but overall very relaxing for those starting their evening off slow and others just enjoying a meal. If I'm ever looking for a low-key atmosphere uptown, I'll definitely think of Wooden Vine.  Not too crowded, great staff, are there better wine bars in Charlotte? Yes. Are there better wine bars on Tryon open late? Nothing comes to mind.   Taking it from a four star to a three: with one stall restrooms for each sex, a woman thought it would be okay to hog the bathroom for something other than its purpose (I'll let you draw your own conclusions), maybe not the WV's fault, but she felt comfortable enough there to do it. Also, chefs and cooks coming out to the bar to fill up their drinks from the soda gun doesn't really bother me, I've done the same thing and I don't mind seeing who cooks the food, but having one come up using a plastic food storage container as his cup? A little unappealing, to say the least.

I went there on a Friday night and it was a very casual, laid-back environment.  The waiter told us to just pick any table we wanted, and didn't mind when we sat at a table meant for 8 since it was the only one open.  They recommended a lovely malbec to go with our meal that I wish didn't come out warm.  We ordered: A pork belly appetizer that I was excited to try but it ended up coming out as an empanada with the pork belly shredded and pulverized.   Travesty. Charcuterie plate - the cheese was good, but the meat came out shredded into little pieces.  Not necessarily a bad thing, but just weird.   Romaine wedge salad - nothing special but it was good  Crab gnocchi - HORRIBLE.  I've never had such bad gnocchi before.  I don't know what they did to that potato but it was tasteless and had the consistency of clay.   I would not recommend it to anybody.

Had a great experience here last night. The waiter was very accommodating. We were able to find a wine that we had another place but couldn't find it since. The waiter offered to get us some bottles if we can by another time. The bruschetta was also very good. Great place for a  date night.

I enjoyed my first visit to Wooden Vine.  The place is decorated in wood throughout.  I didn't get a photo, but check out the split wooden table in the back for larger parties.  Very nice work indeed.    Let me say that the menu was brief, and not enticing.  We ended up with a cheese tray and a salad.  The salad was topped with bits of popcorn; a nice touch.  Don't visit Wooden Vine looking for a big meal, you won't get it here.  However, if you are looking to try a fairly unique wine, this is definitely the place.  The wine selection can be perused in a book.  That's right, they have a book for the wine selection but one sheet of paper for the food.  Clearly, this is a great place to sip the wine of your choosing.  I am giving them 4 stars for the wine selection and won't bother to discuss food options any further.

Just had my First and Last glass of Wine at Wooden Vine...waited 20 min for our second round while 4 bistros were chatting at the register..got up and went to the bar for second and last round...paid with a Hundred dollar bill and 10 minutes later no change...waitress came and said issues with register could we pay any other way...came up with cash..total 24.00  but they said sorry and bye. We had to ask what happened to the 100 dollar bill we gave them...she said OH sorry...and brought it back....and it smelled like Marajuana 3 times while sittng at the booth coming through the kitchen vents... (we owm Hvac company for a livin).....long story short...the owner needs to Clean House......they will make a better profit if they take a closer look at their employees......

I have mixed feelings about this place but am going ahead and giving it 4 stars. The wine selection is fine . . . not fabu, but fine. The tapas or small plates menu is very limited but good. Cheese plates are also medicore. I love the idea and potential of this place, but the crowd seems a bit homogenous and dull . . . not young yuppies/buppies as I had hoped or am looking for.
Great service, wine, and food. A gem in the city of Charlotte.  What an excellent place to hang and have a good time.

Robbed by the bartender (David).  Charged $64.04 on a $24.04 bill with a real $5.96 tip.  David had the gull to charge a $40 tip.  It was during a pub crawl and I was pretty drunk, but little did he know that I keep all my receipts, b/c I have had this happen several times in the past.  I called to complain and spoke directly to David.  He said that he was the owner, which I find it hard to believe.  Hopefully the real owner reads this and fires him. Maybe then I will rescind this post.
